transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Good morning, everyone, and thank you for joining us today. I'll briefly comment on our overall performance, then Jeff, Tom, and Rob will review our third-quarter business highlights, pipeline progress, and financial results in more detail.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: AbbVie continues to perform very well, a testament to the strength of our broad, diversified portfolio.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: I'm especially pleased with the performance of our immunology assets, Skyrizzy and Renvoke.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We delivered adjusted earnings per share of $3.66, exceeding our expectations.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Total net revenues of $14.8 billion were up 5.4% on an operational basis, in line with our expectations.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Immunology, once again, demonstrated impressive results, with Skyrizzy and Renvoke now on pace to deliver more than $7.5 billion in combined sales this year, well ahead of our initial expectations.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: This performance is especially encouraging, recognizing that we're in the early launch phase for both assets in IBD and PSA, as well as Renvoke and atopic dermatitis.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Skyrizzy and Renvoke have established outstanding launch trajectories across existing and new indications, giving us a high degree of confidence and the collective potential for these two assets to ultimately exceed the peak revenues achieved by Humira, achieving the strategic objective we had for replacing Humira.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We also saw a continued strong double-digit operational sales growth from several additional key products, including Botox Cosmetic, Velar, Panclexta, and Botox Therapeutic.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: This strong momentum is helping us offset some of the interim economic pressure we now see in our aesthetics portfolio.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Based on these results, we remain confident in the outlook of our business and are reaffirming the midpoint of our full year 2022 EPS guidance at $13.86, which represents strong double-digit growth.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: As many of you are aware, we have a leading consumer-facing aesthetics portfolio, which is largely cash pay.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We have been monitoring the global economic situation.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Based on all the data we have been observing, especially in the US, with both the Consumer Confidence Index and real personal consumption expenditures trending down and continued high inflation, these factors are putting pressure on consumers' discretionary spending.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: This metric correlates with a slowdown in treatment procedures that we're seeing across the aesthetics markets, impacting the growth rates for toxins, fillers, and body contouring.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: While our U.S. aesthetics market share remains stable across both toxins and fillers, we now believe it's prudent to adjust our full year aesthetics forecast to reflect the moderating market growth over the near to medium term, which is expected to predominantly impact Juvederm as well as our body contouring portfolio products which represent higher price points for consumers.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: While it's difficult to predict the duration of these economic dynamics, we expect these conditions to persist into 2023.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: As consumer confidence improves, we would once again expect the market growth to accelerate.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Our aesthetics portfolio experienced a rapid and sustained recovery following the 2008-2009 recession, so we anticipate any impact will be transient.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Over the long term, the aesthetics business continues to be an extremely attractive, underpenetrated market with significant growth potential.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: The current market dynamics do not change our long-term guidance for aesthetics, and we remain confident in our ability to achieve total sales of more than $9 billion in 2029.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: I also want to provide a brief update on the outlook for 2023.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: With regards to the status of contracting for Chimera, Our intent has always been to maintain broad formulary access so that we can compete effectively with forthcoming biosimilars.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We are making very good progress consistent with this objective and are currently projecting formulary access for at least 80% of all U.S. covered lives.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We expect this percentage to increase further as we conclude additional contract discussions between now and the end of the year.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: As a result, we anticipate strong access for U.S. Humira throughout 2023, and Project Biosimilars will share access as they become available.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We will provide sales guidance for Humira on our fourth quarter call.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: While we're not issuing 2023 guidance today, it is important to note that when we issue our EPS Outlook, we expect the lower end of the range to represent floor earnings.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: So while it's possible 2023 could outperform our guidance, regardless of the shape of the erosion curve, we don't anticipate 2024 earnings will be lower than the initial 2023 EPS guidance, given the momentum and growth from another year of our ex-Humera portfolio, which is expected to more than offset any incremental Humera erosion in 2024.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: We know that many investors have an interest in the timing of AbbVie's trough earnings, whether that be 2023 or 2024.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: The guidance range should provide and give investors additional clarity regarding our expectations for the company's floor EPS.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: In summary, we continue to deliver strong results and see numerous opportunities for a diverse portfolio to drive long-term growth.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: To that end, as noted in our news release, Today, we're announcing a 5% increase in our quarterly cash dividend, from $1.41 per share to $1.48 per share, beginning with the dividend payable in February 2023.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Since our inception, we have grown our quarterly dividend by 270%.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: With that, I'll turn the call over to Jeff for additional comments on our commercial highlights.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Jeff?
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_05

transcript.sentence: Thank you, Rick.

transcript.sentence: In the area of immunology, we had several important regulatory milestones since our last earnings call, receiving FDA approval for RENVOC, a non-radiographic axial spa, and positive CHMP opinion for SCARIZI and Crohn's disease.

transcript.sentence: These developments demonstrate the continued progress we are making with a global indication and expansion of our next generation immunology assets.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: In the quarter, we also saw longer term data from our phase 2 study for RINVOC and systemic lupus where strong responses and flare reductions continued through 48 weeks of treatment.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Based on these results, we plan to advance RINVOC development in this indication and We will be discussing our phase 3 program with regulatory agencies in the coming months.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Now I'd like to provide a few updates on our earlier stage immunology pipeline.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: We recently began a phase 2 study in ulcerative colitis for our RIPK1 inhibitor ABVV668.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: This small molecule inhibitor is designed to address chronic inflammatory diseases by by preventing necroptosis and reducing TLR4 driven inflammation.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: This could be a differentiated approach that has the potential to provide significantly improved efficacy to patients suffering from ulcerative colitis.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: We look forward to providing updates as the data mature.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Turning now to ABBV 154 our anti-TNF steroid conjugate which is being evaluated in multiple indications.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: We recently completed a primary analysis for the phase two dose ranging study in our eight patients.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: The hypothesis for this program was that by delivering the steroid directly to the site of inflammation, you could drive higher rates of efficacy with limited or no effects of systemic steroid exposure.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: In this study, all doses of 154 met the primary endpoint of ACR 50 as well as the majority of secondary endpoints at week 12.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: At the medium and high doses, 154 delivered ACR scores that are similar to RINVOC or slightly better which validates the platform's ability to drive high levels of efficacy.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: The safety profile for 154 was generally consistent with the safety profile for Adalilumab.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: As part of our safety assessment in this study we analyzed metabolic parameters including cortisol levels.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: The data showed minor decreases in cortisol levels at the higher exposures which are consistent with evidence of systemic steroid effects.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Given the number of effective therapies available in RA and a more limited use of steroids in these patients we do not plan to move forward in development for the RA indication.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: However we continue to believe 154 has the potential to provide a benefit in other diseases such as PMR and Crohn's disease where steroid use is part of the typical treatment paradigm.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Our exploratory phase two studies in these two indications are ongoing and we expect to see data from the PMR study in 2023 and from the CRON study in 2024.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Also in the area of immunology we recently made a decision to stop the clinical studies and discontinue development for ABBV 157 our raw gamma T inverse agonist.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: This decision was made due to new findings observed in our preclinical chronic toxicology study.

transcript.sentence: We're seeking accelerated approval based on the positive phase 2 study results for EpcoRitamab in this indication where we saw very deep and durable responses in these highly refractory patients.

transcript.sentence: We expect decisions in both the U.S. and Europe in 2023.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Results from both studies will be included in our regulatory submissions which we expect in the second half of 2023.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: Moving to neuroscience where we have applications under active review for several key assets.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: We anticipate a decision from the FDA in December for RALAR as an injunctive treatment for major depressive disorder.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: We believe it has a potential to be an important new therapy in this patient population and we look forward to bringing this new treatment option to patients.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: We also expect a decision from the FDA in the first half of next year for ABBV951, our innovative subcutaneous levodopa delivery system for treatment of advanced Parkinson's disease.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: And in the area of migraine, we have regulatory applications under review in both the U.S. and Europe for QLIPTA as a preventive treatment for patients with chronic migraine with decisions expected in the first half of next year.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: If approved, this would be another differentiating feature for QLIPTA as it would be the only oral CGRP approved for prevention in patients with chronic migraine.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: This is a common and debilitating disease that significantly impacts quality of life and we look forward to making this new oral treatment option available to patients once approved.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: And in eye care, our partner Regenexx Bio recently announced positive interim data from the phase 2AV8 dose escalation trial for RGX314 using in office supra-choroidal delivery for the treatment of wet AMD.
transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_07

transcript.sentence: RGX314 continues to be well tolerated with no drug related serious adverse events and a meaningful reduction in treatment burden was observed at six months across all those levels.

transcript.sentence: So in summary, we've continued to make significant progress, advancing our programs this year, and we look forward to many more important pipeline milestones in the remainder of this year and into 2023.
